requirements: Prerequisites: ECON 121, a course covering basic probability theory such as ECON 131 or ECON 135, and completion of all MATH requirements of the economics major.Â
description:
Financial economics with special focus on the role of information and the use of markets as forecasting devices. Topics include choice under uncertainty, asset valuation in multi-period models, arbitrage theory, market microstructure, information aggregation, probability elicitation, prediction markets.
Prerequisites: ECON 121, a course covering basic probability theory such as ECON 131 or ECON 135, and completion of all MATH requirements of the economics major.Â
